page_analysis.text_content:
Attic space & equivalencies

Voluminous spaces in a structure contribute to the mass even if these areas are not used or described in the floor plan. The 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency addresses how these areas count toward the gross floor area.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

In Fig 11 below, the highlighted areas count as follows:

• Area A of this 3rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and counts as 3rd floor area.
• Area B of this 2nd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and is included in the count of the, more obvious, 2nd floor area.

Fig 11 Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

Note: 500 sf of unusable attic space may be exempted for Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Note:
Measurements are from top of floor to underside of the rafter

visual_elements.description: Cross-sectional architectural diagram of a house showing attic, closet, and perimeter spaces. Two areas are highlighted and labeled: Area A in the attic space on the 3rd floor, and Area B in a perimeter space on the 2nd floor. A vertical measurement line indicates 5' head clearance from floor to underside of the rafter. Labels indicate '1st floor', 'underside of rafter', and the two highlighted areas A and B. The diagram visually supports the text explaining how these areas count toward gross floor area.
visual_elements.location: Bottom half of the page, centered

additional_notes: Page number 16 at bottom left corner.
The diagram includes handwritten style labels and arrows pointing to architectural features.
Some minor text in the diagram is partially obscured or faint but does not affect critical information extraction.

qualifiers.text: On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

conditions.text: Area A of this 3rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and counts as 3rd floor area.
Area B of this 2nd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head clearance and is included in the count of the, more obvious, 2nd floor area.
500 sf of unusable attic space may be exempted for Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

logical_relationships.expression: If Area A has at least 5' head clearance, then it counts as 3rd floor area.
If Area B has at least 5' head clearance, then it is included in the 2nd floor area count.
If the attic space is unusable and the home is Category 1 or 2 historic, then up to 500 sf may be exempted.

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if areas have at least 5' head clearance to count toward gross floor area.
Determine if attic space is unusable and if the home qualifies as Category 1 or 2 historic for exemption.
